clinical_study.brief_title: IGF-1, Sarcopenia and Mortality: a Cohort Study in Patient With Cognitive Impairment
clinical_study.official_title: Insulin Like Growth Factor 1 and Risks of Sarcopenia and Mortality in Patients With Cognitive Impairment

brief_summary.textblock: Insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF)-1 is an important neuromyotrophic hormone. Disregulation of this hormone has been reported to influence the genesis of cognitive impairment and dementia in the elderly patients. We analyzed the possible link between IGF-1 and risk of Sarcopenia and Mortality in a cohort of elder patients with cognitive impairment.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: IGF-1 reduction in patients with sarcopenia
primary_outcome.description: IGF-1 reduction could be linked to sarcopenia in patients with cognitive impairment

secondary_outcome.measure: IGF-1 reduction and mortality in patients with cognitive impairment
secondary_outcome.description: IGF-1 could be an independent risk factor for mortality in patients with cognitive impairment

arm_group.description: Reduction of IGF-1 serum value in a cohort of patients with cognitive impairment
Reduction of IGF-1 serum value in a cohort of patients with cognitive impairment

intervention.description: Evaluation of IGF-1 serum value at baseline, 24 and 48 months

study_pop.textblock: Consecutive patients were enrolled from orthopedics clinic (IRCCS Galeazzi Milan) and geriatric day service (Sapienza University of Rome)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of cognitive impairment (MMSE < 24)
- Age > 65 ys
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of pancreatic disorders
- Diagnosis of acromegaly
- Diagnosis of GH-related disorders
- Recent bone fractures or immobility before the enrollment (3 months)
- Cancer
